Pittsburgh City Paper
About Us
Pittsburgh City Paper‚Äòs mission is to serve the greater Pittsburgh region with journalistic integrity, wit, and compassion, while amplifying the voices in the communities we serve, through both our news reporting and our arts and entertainment coverage.
The first issue of City Paper was printed on Nov. 6, 1991, and we have been serving the city ever since. Free issues of City Paper are distributed every Wednesday throughout the Greater Pittsburgh region, and new content is uploaded daily, without paywalls, online at pghcitypaper.com.
You can follow City Paper on social media at bsky.app/profile/pghcitypaper.com, Facebook.com/PittsburghCityPaper, and Instagram.com/PghCityPaper.
You can subscribe to City Pigeon, our newsletter here to get our most recent stories emailed straight to your inbox.
Pittsburgh City Paper is owned by Cars Holding Inc. and is a member of AAN, the Association of Alternative Newsmedia; the Pennsylvania NewsMedia Association; and The Pittsburgh Media Partnership.

First Friday 5Rhythms¬Æ Waves
First Friday of every month, 7-9 p.m.
Wightman School
5604 Solway, Pittsburgh
25.00
Dance
The 5Rhythms¬Æ comprise simple movement practice designed to release the dancer that lives in everybody, no matter what shape, size, age limitation and experience. To find your dance is to find yourself, at your most fluid and creative level. While the practice itself is the essence of simplicity, it has the power to catalyze deep healing and creative expression. The primary teaching of this work is: If you put the psyche in motion, it will heal itself. The five rhythms are Flowing, Staccato, Chaos, Lyrical and Stillness. They come together to create the Wave, a movement meditation practice. 412-370-3607

Panel Discussion: Preserving Gilded Age Pittsburgh
Thu., Nov. 6, 6:30-8 p.m.
The Frick Pittsburgh
7227 Reynolds Street, Pittsburgh
$15 members; $20 non-members; $10 students
Lecture
In the Gilded Age, Pittsburgh reigned supreme as an industrial powerhouse. While echoes of that legacy inform Pittsburgh‚Äôs identity today, little of that history survives intact and accessible to the public. Two organizations, The Frick Pittsburgh and Rivers of Steel, exist to preserve those stories through the stewardship of their respective historic sites, Clayton, the home of Henry Clay Frick, and Carrie Blast Furnace. Both sites are currently in the middle of largescale, multi-year preservation projects that will ensure their survival into the future. A short Q&A will follow the panel discussion. 412-371-0600

Landmark Lectures: People & Place - Bishop Benjamin Tucker Tanner & Family
Third Thursday of every month, 6:30-7:30 p.m.
GET TICKETS
free with registration
Matthew Falcone, President of Preservation Pittsburgh, will talk regarding the possibility of applying for a historic marker for Bishop Tanner (1835-1923). With roots in Pittsburgh, Tanner was a leading clergyman, author, and was editor from 1868-1884 of The Christian Recorder, the largest Black-owned newspaper in the country at the time. Tanner and his wife Sarah had four children, including Henry Ossawa Tanner, who was the first Black painter to gain international acclaim, as well as Halle Tanner Dillon Johnson, one of the first Black women physicians. 4122568755

First Unitarian Church
605 Morewood Avenue, Pittsburgh
$25/month dues
Auditions, Community
The Coro Latinoamericano - Pittsburgh, founded in 1997, is a secular community choir with a professional director. We are dedicated to building bridges to other peoples and cultures in Pittsburgh and beyond through choral music from the countries of Central and South America, the Caribbean, and the Iberian Peninsula. As a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, Coro Latinoamericano - Pittsburgh is committed to educational outreach and the cultural enrichment of the Pittsburgh and Southwestern Pennsylvania region, and beyond. Knowledge of Spanish and/or music sight-reading are not required, but a plus. We've recently collaborated with the Mendelssohn Choir and the Heritage Gospel Chorale. 412-345-1047
